outputs.output_descr:
The project focuses on:
1) phasing out Chlorofluorocarbons (CFC) consumption in accordance with Montreal Protocol targets.
 This will be done through:
a) Non compromise of the performance or effectiveness of the refrigeration system in Zambia
b) Minimizing the economic impact on the small and medium entrepreneurs
c) Developing a sustainable system for zero consumption of the CFCS

"
The main objectives of Terminal Phase-out Management Plan in Zambia are as follows:
1)	To enable the Government to phase-out its Chlorofluorocarbons (CFC) consumption in accordance with the phase out targets of the Montreal Protocol. 
2)	To achieve the CFC phase-out without compromising the performance or effectiveness of the refrigeration system in Zambia;
3)	To minimize the economic impact of the country of achieving the CFC phase-out;
4)	To eliminate over a period of three years 20082010, the remaining consumption of CFC in Zambia;
5)	To ensure that measure are in place to sustain not only CFC phase-out, but also sustain zero consumption of CFCs.

project_descr: Capacity building for terminal phase out of ozone layer depleting substances in Zambia
